content:
You're right. Let me clarify.

I have **two sets of powers**:

**1. OpenClaw Native Tools** (the foundation)
- File system (read/write/edit)
- Shell execution
- Web search & fetch
- Browser control
- Messaging (Signal, Telegram, Discord, etc.)
- Cron jobs & scheduling
- Node control (camera, screen, notifications)
- Memory search (MEMORY.md + memory/*.md)
- Session management & sub-agents

**2. Nitara Tool Registry** (the 39 business capabilities)
- All the domain-specific tools I listed before (inbox, projects, ideas council, CRM, financials, etc.)

The Nitara tools are **implemented on top of** OpenClaw's infrastructure. They call out to your backend services, but I invoke them through the tool calling mechanism you've built.

So when you ask "what are my powers from the tool registry" â€” do you mean specifically the Nitara-side registry, or are you asking about something else I'm missing?
